intro: Diaphananthe plehniana, commonly known as the plehnian waxplant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its waxy, glossy leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, warm environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a houseplant.
